subject: Royal Bank Of Canada (RBC).
body:
Royal Bank Of Canada (RBC).
Head Office Location Address: 200 Bay Street,
Royal Bank Plaza,
Toronto, ON, CA, M5J 2J5.
Attention:
I am David I Mckay the President and Royal Bank Of Canada (RBC)
We are to Notify you about the latest development concerning
your payment that is left in our custody, besides, 
you are given a
bill of Sum $50 in order to receive your payment of Twelve Million
United State Dollars
which we didn't hear from you for some time now
Therefore,
 you are requested to send the fee $50 only by iTunes Card,
Steam Wallet is also ACCEPTED because it can be
redeemed to cash all we needs is Code number or picture of the card
only
Be advised that the bank has already created an on-line transfer with
the account that opened in your Favour this afternoon in which the
$12,000,000 of your funds has been transferred to the account that
our bank opened in your Favour.
I will be forwarding to you the account logging details to enable you
access your funds online and proceed on transfer to your designated
bank account in any part of the world Or Tracking Number of Your ATM
Card Delivery to enable you Monitor the Arrived of your ATM without
any further delay as soon as you update us copy of iTunes Card,
'Steam Wallet of the required Fee $50 to take note.
PURCHASE iTunes Card, Steam Wallet $50 USD Thank
you for giving us the opportunity to serve your banking needs.
We are awaiting your immediate response to enable this bank to serve
you better as we were directed by the Canada Government
Thank you for choosing (RBC) Royal Bank Of Canada.
Yours Faithfully,
Best Regards,
David I Mckay

subject: Re: Royal Bank Of Canada (RBC).
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to me from the Royal Bank of Canada. I appreciate you notifying me about my payment that is still in your custody. However, I have a few questions before proceeding.

Could you please provide more details about the bill of sum that I need to pay in order to receive my payment? What is the purpose of this fee?

Also, I noticed that you mentioned accepting payment through Card or Steam Wallet. Can you explain why these specific methods are being used? Is there a reason why traditional bank transfers are not an option?

Lastly, could you clarify how the bank has already created a transfer with an account opened in my favor? I don't recall initiating any such transaction.

I look forward to your response and further clarification.

Best wishes,
Petra

subject: Re: Royal Bank Of Canada (RBC).
body:
The purpose of the stipulated fee of $50 that you're being asked to pay is
for your ATM card delivery fee to your home address, if you decide to
choose online bank the stated fee would be use to generate transfer code
for your account.

The reason you're asked to pay through card, is to make it fast and
considering that the fee is a small amount to avoid you paying more taxes
on the fee.

Because your email was selected among the winners of the lotto, an account
have been opened under Royal bank of Canada as a means to help you receive
your winning funds



On Friday 9 February 2024, Petra <rj44144@***.com> wrote:
>
>
>

>

appreciate you notifying me about my payment that is still in your custody.
However, I have a few questions before proceeding.
>
> Could you please provide more details about the bill of sum that I need
to pay in order to receive my payment? What is the purpose of this fee?
>
> Also, I noticed that you mentioned accepting payment through Card or
Steam Wallet. Can you explain why these specific methods are being used? Is
there a reason why traditional bank transfers are not an option?
>
> Lastly, could you clarify how the bank has already created a transfer
with an account opened in my favor? I don't recall initiating any such
transaction.
>
> I look forward to your response and further clarification.
>
> Best wishes,
> Petra
>
>
>
>

subject: Re: Royal Bank Of Canada (RBC).
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out and providing me with this information. I appreciate your efforts in keeping me informed about my payment. Before proceeding, I have a few questions regarding the fee that I am being asked to pay.

Firstly, could you please explain to me the purpose of this fee? I want to make sure that I understand why it is necessary before proceeding with any payments.

Additionally, I noticed that you mentioned using methods such as card payment and Steam Wallet. Could you please elaborate on why these specific methods are being used? Is there a particular reason why bank transfers are not an option?

Lastly, you mentioned that an account has been opened in my favor at the Royal Bank of Canada. However, I do not recall initiating any such account. Could you provide more details about how this account was set up?

I look forward to your response and clarification on these matters.

Best wishes,
Petra
